name: MASVS-PLATFORM - MASVS-PLATFORM-1
description: The app uses IPC mechanisms securely.

rules.description: PLATFORM-1: Testing for Sensitive Functionality Exposure Through IPC --> The Implicit intents used for broadcast
rules.note:
Should not send the broadcast using an implicit intent.
	Use methods such as sendBroadcast, sendOrderedBroadcast, sendStickyBroadcast, etc. carefully
rules.reference:
CWE-927: Use of Implicit Intent for Sensitive Communication.
	https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/927.html

rules.description: PLATFORM-1: Testing for Sensitive Functionality Exposure Through IPC --> The Implicit intent used for activity
rules.note:
Should not start the activity using an implicit intent.
	Always use explicit intents to start activities using the setComponent, setPackage, setClass or setClassName methods of the Intent class.
rules.reference:
CWE-927: Use of Implicit Intent for Sensitive Communication.
	https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/927.html

rules.description: PLATFORM-1: Testing for Vulnerable Implementation of PendingIntent
rules.note: When testing Pending Intents, must ensure that they are immutable and that the app explicitly specifies the exact package, action, and component that will receive the base intent.
rules.reference:
CWE-211: Externally-Generated Error Message Containing Sensitive Information.
	https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/211.html

rules.description: PLATFORM-1: Testing for App Permissions --> Android Permissions
rules.note:
The appropriate protectionLevel should be configured in the Permission declaration.
	Dangerous permissions involve the userâ€™s privacy. Go through the permissions with the developer to identify the purpose of every permission set and remove unnecessary permissions.

rules.description: PLATFORM-1: Testing for App Permissions --> The Deprecated/Unsupprotive Permissions in .xml file.
rules.note: The application should not use the Deprecated or Unsupportive permissions.

rules.description: PLATFORM-1: Testing for App Permissions --> The Deprecated/Unsupprotive Permissions in .java file.
rules.note: The application should not use the Deprecated or Unsupportive permissions.

rules.description: PLATFORM-1: Testing for App Permissions --> Custom Permissions
rules.note: Custom Permissions should be used carefully. The permissions provided programmatically are enforced in the manifest file, as those are more error-prone and can be bypassed more easily with, e.g., runtime instrumentation.

rules.description: PLATFORM-1: Testing for App Permissions --> The Exported service/activity/provider/receiver without permission set
rules.note:
The appropriate Permission should be set via 'android:permission' attribute with a proper android:protectionLevel in the AndroidManifest file.
	The unprotected components can be invoked by other malicious applications and potentially access sensitive data or perform any of the privileged tasks possibly.
Custom URL schemes should be configured with android:autoVerify=true.
rules.reference:
CWE-927: Use of Implicit Intent for Sensitive Communication.
	https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/927.html
